comments:
Import a log file and then try to reimport the same log using the same inpout parameters. Choose not to append or replace to the existing log file. A NullPointerExcpetion is logged into the Eclipse log. 
The same exception happens when one chooses to merge the imported file with an existing and when No is selected to the same question as above.
the excpetion trace stack:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.logui.internal.wizards.ImportLogWizard.importLog(ImportLogWizard.java:1852)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.logui.internal.wizards.ImportLogWizard.run(ImportLogWizard.java:322)
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.BusyIndicator.showWhile(BusyIndicator.java:67)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.logui.internal.wizards.ImportLogWizard.performFinish(ImportLogWizard.java:243)
...........
This problem is a regression introduced in 4.3 during the import log wizard code refactoring required for the common services feature. The problem doesn't occur in 4.2.1.
*** Bug 165265 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Not a stop ship for 4.3i3, target to 4.4.

The sequence to reproduce also includes:

1) import a log file
2) import the same log file and choose replace
3) repeat 2) (in your import log dialog you should have two identical logs to import and the prompt should happen twice).

If you choose to replace the log file both times, the following error occurrs:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.log.internal.core.LocalImportHandler.importLog(LocalImportHandler.java:73)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.logui.internal.wizards.ImportLogWizard$LocalLogImportJob.run(ImportLogWizard.java:1011)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)


Let me know if you agree that this is a duplicate of the defect described here. If not, I will open a separate defect. This was found in TPTP 4.3.1 candidate driver.
I think this cannot be included in 4.3.1, it should have been on the proposed list of critical defects.

The error I am seeing also causes there to be an error importing the log file but only in the case where you have two identical logs and you choose to replace them both (as in step 3) above). This was discovered during 4.3.1 testing today.
I would propose to raise the severity to major based on the error importing the log file. Please do so if you agree.
Can you describe the scenario and provide also the stack trace?

1) Import apache_access.log (should complete successfully)
2) File>Import>LogFile> Next> Add >OK
3) Should show two apache_access.log files to be imported
4) Finish
5) Select replace when prompted
6) Select replace when prompted
7) The import fails with "error importing log file"

I could not reproduce the problem with the original reported scenerio with the TPTP 4.4 i2 test driver.  However I did reproduce the problem with Liz's scenario.  While this is a problem, I feel it is such an uncommon scenario that it can be deferred.  Deferring to future.
This is nice to have from AC perspective
